universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class RecyclerViewWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
          • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.RecyclerViewWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewManager, ViewParent, Refreshable, Scrollable, Slideable, Widget, WidgetGroup

    public class RecyclerViewWidget
extends RecyclerView
implements WidgetGroup, Refreshable
    Extended version of RecyclerView. This updated RecyclerView supports tinting for the Android versions below LOLLIPOP and other useful features described below including swipe to refresh and pulling feature.

    Tinting

    Tinting is supported via Xml attributes listed below:
    • uiBackgroundTint
    • uiBackgroundTintMode

    Note, that on LOLLIPOP and above SDK versions can be also used Xml attributes listed above where in such case will be used the native tinting.

    This widget group also overrides all SDK methods used to tint its components like setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) or setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode), so these can be used regardless the current version of SDK but invoking of these methods below LOLLIPOP can be done only directly upon instance of this widget group otherwise NoSuchMethodException will be thrown.

    Swipe to refresh

    This feature can be enabled/disabled via setRefreshEnabled(boolean) or via Xml attribute uiRefreshEnabled. To receive callback about initiated refresh you need to register OnRefreshListener via Refreshable.setOnRefreshListener(OnRefreshListener). Whenever its OnRefreshListener#onRefresh(Refreshable) callback is invoked a refresh indicator is already visible and 'spinning'. When refresh process if finished the indicator can be hided (dismissed) via setRefreshing(false). This method can be also used to show (pop) the indicator manually, for example when a refresh button has been pressed. For configuration of refresh indicator and also all parameters used to support refresh feature see RefreshController by which is this feature supported within this widget. Each refreshable widget uses its own RefreshController that can be accessed via getRefreshController().

    Sliding

    This updated view group allows updating of its current position along x and y axis by changing fraction of these properties depending on its current size using the new animation framework introduced in HONEYCOMB via ObjectAnimators API.

    Changing of fraction of X or Y is supported via these two methods:

    • setFractionX(float)
    • setFractionY(float)

    For example if an instance of this view group class needs to be slided to the right by its whole width, an Xml file with ObjectAnimator would look like this: 

      <objectAnimator xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
                  android:propertyName="fractionX"
                  android:valueFrom="0.0"
                  android:valueTo="1.0"
                  android:duration="300"/>
    This can be especially useful for fragment transitions framework, where this view group would be used as a root for a view hierarchy of a specific fragment.

    XML attributes

    See RecyclerView, RecyclerViewWidget Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiRecyclerViewStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    ListViewWidget, GridViewWidget

      Creates a new instance of RecyclerViewWidget for the given context.

        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

      • setFractionX

        public void setFractionX(float fraction)
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Sets the fraction for X axis of this view. This fraction determines how this view should be moved along its X axis depends on its current width.

        Setting this value for example to 1 will move this view by 100 % of its width to the right.

        Note, that setting this value out of the proper range can resolve into unpredictable results.

        Specified by:
        setFractionX in interface Slideable
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [-1, 1].

      • getFractionX

        public float getFractionX()
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Returns the current fraction for the X axis of this view.
        Specified by:
        getFractionX in interface Slideable
        Returns:
        Fraction for X axis.

      • setFractionY

        public void setFractionY(float fraction)
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Sets the fraction for Y axis of this view. This fraction determines how this view should be moved along its Y axis depends on its current height.

        Setting this value for example to -1 will move this view by 100 % of its height to the top.

        Note, that setting this value out of the proper range can resolve into unpredictable results.

        Specified by:
        setFractionY in interface Slideable
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [-1, 1].

      • getFractionY

        Description copied from interface: Slideable

        Specified by:
        getFractionY in interface Slideable
        Returns:
        Fraction for Y axis.

      • setRefreshEnabled

        public void setRefreshEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Sets a flag indicating whether the refresh feature is enabled for this view or not.

        Enabling this feature means, that a user can swipe down this view to refresh it if Refreshable.isRefreshGestureEnabled(), otherwise only refresh indicator can be shown/dismissed programmatically for this view via Refreshable.setRefreshing(boolean) method.

        Specified by:
        setRefreshEnabled in interface Refreshable
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable refresh, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshEnabled, Refreshable.isRefreshEnabled(), Refreshable.setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean)

      • isRefreshEnabled

        public boolean isRefreshEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Returns a flag indicating whether the refresh feature is enabled for this view or not.
        Specified by:
        isRefreshEnabled in interface Refreshable
        Returns:
        True if the refresh is enabled, so the refresh indicator can be shown for this view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.setRefreshEnabled(boolean), Refreshable.isRefreshGestureEnabled()

      • setRefreshGestureEnabled

        public void setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Unlike Refreshable.setRefreshEnabled(boolean) this will enable/disable the refresh gesture so a user can/cannot swipe down this view to refresh it.
        Specified by:
        setRefreshGestureEnabled in interface Refreshable
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable refresh gesture, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshGestureEnabled, Refreshable.isRefreshGestureEnabled()

      • isRefreshGestureEnabled

        public boolean isRefreshGestureEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Returns a flag indicating whether the refresh gesture is enabled for this view or not.
        Specified by:
        isRefreshGestureEnabled in interface Refreshable
        Returns:
        True if the refresh gesture is enabled, so a user can swipe down this view to refresh its content, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.setRefreshGestureEnabled(boolean), Refreshable.setRefreshEnabled(boolean)

      • setRefreshing

        public void setRefreshing(boolean refreshing)
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Sets a flag indicating whether this view is being refreshing or not. This flag determines whether to show the refresh indicator for this view or not.

        This should be called whenever the refresh for this view has been finished, so the indicator can be dismissed by setRefreshing(false), or whenever the refresh has been initiated by pressing a button, so the indicator should be popped by #setRefreshing(true).

        Note, that this does not need to be called from within OnRefreshListener.onRefresh(Refreshable) callback, as during this callback is the refresh indicator already showing.

        Specified by:
        setRefreshing in interface Refreshable
        Parameters:
        refreshing - True if this view is being refreshing, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.isRefreshing()

      • isRefreshing

        public boolean isRefreshing()
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Returns a flag indicating whether this view is being refreshing or not.
        Specified by:
        isRefreshing in interface Refreshable
        Returns:
        True if this view is being refreshing, so the refresh indicator is visible and spinning, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.setRefreshing(boolean)

      • setRefreshIndicatorTransition

        public void setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int transition)
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Sets the transition type for the refresh indicator. The transition determines the way how the refresh indicator should be transitioned while it is being pulled up/down by a user.

        Note, that for now Refreshable.TRANSITION_COPLANAR and Refreshable.TRANSITION_ABOVE behaves the same way. This is scheduled to be changed in the feature.

        Specified by:
        setRefreshIndicatorTransition in interface Refreshable
        Parameters:
        transition - The desired transition. One of Refreshable.TRANSITION_BELOW, Refreshable.TRANSITION_COPLANAR or Refreshable.TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        ui:uiRefreshIndicatorTransition, Refreshable.getRefreshIndicatorTransition()

      • getRefreshIndicatorTransition

        public int getRefreshIndicatorTransition()
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Returns the current transition type used for the refresh indicator hiding/showing.
        Specified by:
        getRefreshIndicatorTransition in interface Refreshable
        Returns:
        One of Refreshable.TRANSITION_BELOW, Refreshable.TRANSITION_COPLANAR or Refreshable.TRANSITION_ABOVE.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.setRefreshIndicatorTransition(int)

      • setDrawRefreshIndicator

        public void setDrawRefreshIndicator(boolean draw)
        Description copied from interface: Refreshable
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether this refreshable view should draw its refresh indicator as part of its own drawing or not.

        This can be useful to draw refresh indicator outside of bounds of this view or at the different view hierarchy level if needed.

        Default value: true

        Specified by:
        setDrawRefreshIndicator in interface Refreshable
        Parameters:
        draw - True to draw indicator as part of this view's graphics, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.drawsRefreshIndicator()

      • drawsRefreshIndicator

        Specified by:
        drawsRefreshIndicator in interface Refreshable
        Returns:
        True if refresh indicator is drawn by this view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Refreshable.setDrawRefreshIndicator(boolean)

      • saveTempLayoutState

        public boolean saveTempLayoutState()
        Saves current state of this view's layout temporarily.

        Saved temporary layout state can be later restored via restoreTempLayoutState().

        Returns:
        True if this view's layout state has been saved, false if there is no layout of which state to save.
        See Also:
        saveLayoutState()

      • saveLayoutState

        @Nullable
public Parcelable saveLayoutState()
        Saves current state of this view's layout.

        Saved layout state that can be later restored via restoreLayoutState(Parcelable).

        Returns:
        Layout saved state or null if there is no layout manager specified for this view.
        See Also:
        LayoutManager#onSaveInstanceState()

      • restoreTempLayoutState

        public boolean restoreTempLayoutState()
        Restores the temporarily saved layout state previously saved via saveTempLayoutState().
        Returns:
        True if state of this view's layout has been restored, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        restoreLayoutState(Parcelable)

      • restoreLayoutState

        public void restoreLayoutState(@NonNull
                               Parcelable layoutState)
        Restores the layout state previously saved via saveLayoutState().
        Parameters:
        layoutState - The state to which to restore this view's layout.
        See Also:
        LayoutManager#onRestoreInstanceState(Parcelable), restoreTempLayoutState()
